data.title: Good food - Terrible service
data.text: Arrived at the restaurant at 6:25pm and was told there would be a 10 minute wait.  The hostess did not take down names for anyone coming in.  Proceeded to seat two parties ahead of me.  We were in a time crunch so this was concerning. Finally seated 40 minutes later, asked the waiter if there was going to be a problem getting the food served within 40 minutes.  He assured us it wouldn't be.  Food arrived 45 minutes later.  Had to have it boxed up as we were late for a concert.  Thought getting an hour and a half early would have been adequate.  Poorly managed, inexperienced servers.  Good food though.

data.title: We enjoyed it
data.text:
MY husband is a New Yorker of Italian descent and he loved his pasta.
Glad we found it and we really enjoyed it.

data.title: Used to be the best lunch in town
data.text:
I work in one of the buildings right downtown Provo.  That means that over the years, we regularly went to Glorias Little Italy.  We could rely on plentiful fresh hot food.  It was always amazing.  We would start talking about going to Gloria's early on during the day so that we'd all be excited come the lunch hour to go partake of it wonderful food.  But, something happened in the last three - five months.  They went to an Express Lunch theme.  The Express Lunch just isn't as impressive as their lunches used to be.  One kid seems to be running the place.  He takes the orders, he brings out the food, he cuts the cake for the desserts, he dishes up the gelato.  It doesn't work!  He deserves a pat on the back, but he can't do it all!  Little things get forgotten or left undone.

In the past we could always count on fresh hot food.  The last two times that we went there for lunch, the food wasn't fresh nor hot.  This past Tuesday, my wife and I went there hoping for the best but kind of dreading that it was going to be more of the same.  

I got the Penne Arrabiata (a spicy red sauce)  Every 4th or 5th slice of sausage was still cold.  Obviously, they fry up a bunch of sausage slices and refrigerate them until needed.  Then, pull them out of the refrigerator and warm them up in a skillet and add the red sauce.  There is no other way to explain refrigerator temperature sausages.  What happened to fresh food?

After Ottavios went out of business, the next best place to get tomato basil soup was there at Gloria's Little Italy.  However, the soup just isn't as good as it used to be.  On top of that, I had to request that the server (yes, that same kid who was handling everything in front-end of the restaurant) take and warm up the soup the rest of the way.  Some soups are supposed to be eaten cold.  But, tomato basil soup isn't one of those.  After getting him to warm up my soup, I wasn't about to complain to him about my sausages.  

My wife's chicken alfredo was really good.  She loved it!  It seemed to be hot and fresh.  She obviously made the lucky choice.  I was a little jealous of her meal choice.  Although, over the years I have ordered the penne arrabiata maybe 10 times, this time it was sadly lacking.

My wife and I ordered a slice of cake.  Mmmm...  Now that is something that hasn't suffered with the change to the Express Lunch.  Although there were only three cakes in the display case.  In the past, there have been so many choices that it made it hard to decide what to have.  Maybe that is also a sign of an absentee owner.

I think that since this is a family owned restaurant, the family needs to get involved in it again.  Leaving it up to non-family to run the kitchen isn't working!  They don't have the love, pride, and investment in the restaurant that needs to be there.  When the owner is on-site things always run better.

data.title: Yep going down
data.text: food ok not as good as it used to be - terrible lack of waiters they were good but only 2 in the whole place meant for little service.  The ceiling fans cooled off our food immediately even though I asked to turn them off they said "I would have to get a ladder and climb up" them right over our food!! so sad to see the place go down.

data.title: Absolutely terrible
data.text: I've been here maybe three or four times. Each time is just terrible. Once, my mother's chicken was raw. Another time, I was given cold soup (it was supposed to be hot). The gelato is good. But, it's not really even part of the restaurant. Don't go here.

data.title: Past its prime  - RUN AWAY!!!
data.text:
From the locals, this place used to be exceptional. This is no longer the case.  The food was embarrassing, the ingredients listed for the dish were not included.  The service was beyond terrible.  Can't even describe it.  Server would bring a portion of the tables drinks and not return with the rest.  Half the guests got their soup, but not the rest.  Same thing happened with the salads.   Items were omitted.  One person did not receive their food.  The restaurant was not busy.  Out of many items, but not told until they delivered an alternate dish.  
Run!!!  Believe the reviews.

data.title: Over priced, not what is used to be
data.text: Well the elegance is gone, in my opinion, for Gloria's.  I've taken my wife there for dinner on many occasions over the years.  I've seen it slip further into a mess every year.  My wife loves gnocchi and Gloria's is the only place, in Utah County, that we're aware of that has it.  At any rate, we went just last Friday and sadly it just isn't the same.  The entire restaurant is in need of a make up.  The walls are filthy and the decorations need a good dusting.  There are mismatched salt and pepper shakers.  I watch as someone brought a huge dog into the place.  It wasn't a service dog either.  The dog stayed by the front sitting area, but honestly I was ready to go the second I saw it.  One of the waitresses was petting it.  I really hope she washed her hands before serving food.  The desert selection has really gone down hill as well.  We didn't even order one because none of them looked good.  At any rate, I can say that I'm sad to see this once great place to eat become run down.  It's like the place needs a visit from Gordan Ramsey and Kitchen Nightmares.  The food is bland and way too expensive for what you get.  A small salad, dry toasted bread, and a plate of boring gnocchi.

data.title: Disappointing food and serice
data.text: A friend, who highly recommended Gloria's, and I had dinner there on 8/15/2016.  There was no one at the front of the restaurant to seat us and that was awkward.  When the waiter brought the soup, a basil tomato, it was not even lukewarm.  We had a difficult time getting the waiter back.  When He brought another bowl, which was hot, the flavor was good.  The lasagna was good and my friend's spinach ravioli was acceptable.  The entire experience, for the price, was underwhelming and disappointing.

data.title: Horrible, Just Horrible! Stay Away!
data.text: If I could give zero stars I would! This place is the worst, I called ahead of time for a group of 20+ and was told we could be accommodated. We arrived at 6:30pm and the service was horrible, 1 high schooler was our server for a group of 20+! We ended up serving ourselves refills on drinks because we were never checked on. It took at least 30 minutes to order food and it took over 2 hours to get the food. By 8:30pm there was 10 of us who hadn't eaten yet. My dinner arrived dead last, the pasta was cold, too much sauce, and the chicken was tougher than shoe leather. We tried to complain to the manager or owner and the manager was a high school student, she informed us we would get 40% refunded back well then she did the refund and it was barely 10%! That didn't even cover the 10 people who didn't get to eat with the group. Half the orders were wrong. It was seriously store bought sauce and box pasta, don't waste your time!

data.title: Surly Service, Mediocre Food
data.text: Had a reservation and we were seated quickly but with something resembling a snarl.  The few extra things we asked for were grudgingly provided if provided at all (extra sauce - "we'll have to reheat it in the microwave", San Pellegrino - "we're out", what flavors of gelato - "you'll have to go and look yourself") Inexcusable and rude.  If the service weren't bad enough the food nearly matched it.  Several portions were barely tired and one person in our party got sick from the food. Go anywhere but here.

data.title: No service
data.text: We hadn't been to Gloria's in over a year but remembered how good the food was. We had a party of 14, we made reservations. They quickly sat us and then we had water in about ten minutes. After thirty minutes we had to flag someone down to find out who our server was. He came back now 40 minutes after we sat down and took our order. Another Thirty minutes later we had no appetizers, no salads so we all got up and walked out. Never have I felt so completely forgotten in a restaurant!

data.title: Step above average
data.text: Local restaurant, quickly greeted and seated.  Service was okay, had to drag suggestions out of the server.  Squash soup was bland, got better with fresh ground pepper.  Had the house take on chicken parmesan interesting not outstanding.  Locals rave about this place not sure why.

data.title: Great food and fast service.
data.text:
We dined here prior to the Utah valley marathon. The food was exceptional. The service was not great. Basically we got our dinner and that was all we saw of our waitress. 

The piano is a joke. A player piano is supposed to be filling the restaurant with classic piano pieces, but the piano has files so corrupted that it sounds like you are listening to a teenager practicing some classics. Missing notes and awkward rhythm. It was really irritating and I can't believe nobody at the restaurant cared enough to either turn it off or fix it!

data.title: 3 Out of 4 Gives them a "C".
data.text: We selected this restaurant more out of desperation that desire as our top picks were all booked up.  We arrived and were 1 of four tables in the entire restaurant with customers and it still took 10-15 minutes before we received our menus and drinks.  This was the hallmark of the night as two other tables that came in after we did got their food first.  Our appetizer took forever and came just a few minutes before our entree.  There was no explanation or apology for the delay.  Water refills?...no...I had to flag down a busboy.  In hindsight we should have taken them up on the offer for a pitcher for our table.  Lastly, the lasagna was terrible.  We all tasted it and all agreed it was the worst we have had....about as bland and unflavorful as can be.  I would not recommend this restaurant and would go to Olive Garden before I'd go back to this "authentic" Italian restaurant.

data.title: OK Food, Bad execution
data.text: We went there for dinner since a place nearby had a long wait. The food was OK. We had 4 different people waiting on us at various points which was confusing. We ordered 2 local beers and they were out of one and only had one bottle of the other. When we sat down there were 3 dirty tables near us that never got cleared in the 30 minutes we were there for dinner. The staff wasn't that busy that they couldn't clear the tables and reset them. After my experience it was obvious why they are not busy as some other restaurants in their area.

data.title: The food was excellent and the accordian player was great.
data.text:
Great atmosphere on a Saturday evening. The food was very good and everyone at our table ordered something different and enjoyed it.  The prices were a bit on the high side, but we were full and satisfied with the quality.

Midway through the meal, we were delighted to be entertained by an elderly accordian player who sang very well in both English and Italian and even made us laugh.  I would definitely come here again for a special occaision.

data.title: Expensive for what you get.
data.text: First of all, we found the prices a bit high.  You get your choice of soup or salad.  My companion ordered the 'Mushroom Tortellini' ($17.95) and they were very good.  I ordered their heralded 'Gnocchi' with the prago sauce ($18).  The prago sauce was advertised as a tomato sauce with ground beef and pork.   I could hardly see any meat. The sauce tasted like tomato only, could not taste any other spices nor the meat.  A little parmesan cheese on top left us wanting more, but the server never checked with us to see if we needed anything else.  The gnocchis were ok, I would not recommend for the price.  No wine or alcoholic beverages available.

data.title: Go for the food, stay for the accordion
data.text: The food was delicious, it is a very communal, family atmosphere.  I think the food tasted even better because we were kept in such good moods by the wacky accordion guy!

data.title: ONE OF PROVO'S OLDEST TRADITIONS GREAT ITALIAN FOOD
data.text: My husband, son and I ate lunch here.  Everything is made in house. Their breads are fantastic.  Their Fettuccine Alfredo is one of their most popular dishes.  They make amazing desserts and their house made gelato is to die for.  I can see why they've been around so long.  Take a trip on over to Center Street and check out Gloria's Little Italy.  I'm sure it will quickly become one of your favorites.

data.title: Graduation celebration ruined
data.text:
Made a reservation for a graduation celebration - party of 6. The service was so slow we ended up leaving after having been there for 1.5 hours with no entrees.  Turns out our meal was actually ready at one point but it got sent back to the kitchen because no one brought it out to us. 

Soup and salad was given to us but apparently they have a shortage of spoons because when we asked for a clean one, we were told they were all out. They were also out of ice for beverages all evening. 

They redeemed themselves by giving us gift certificates to return but we live out of state so they aren't much good to us. 

If you can't handle "the busiest weekend of the year" don't take so many reservations!
